subject: Re: How to determine what the error is when running a JUnit test via Ant?
msgSnippet: Now that I think about it I know the reason why I m not seeing this stack trace output -- I m using a custom XML result formatter which I derived from Ant s
messageBody:
Now that I think about it I know the reason why I'm not seeing this
stack trace output -- I'm using a custom XML result formatter which I
derived from Ant's XMLJUnitResultFormatter which is gobbling the
exception stack trace info (it only leaves the meaningful messages I
add into the thrown exceptions in my code). I needed to shorten the
report output for failures and so I created this custom result
formatter, but for errors I really do want to see the exception stack
trace. So I need to modify my result formatter to handle error
messages differently than failure messages, or just stop using my own
result formatter until I work out these errors.


--James



--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "james_adams" <james_adams@...> wrote:
>
> I'm running a JUnit test via Ant's <junit> task. It completes with an
> error, but I have yet to determine what the error is. I have tried
> using the <record> Ant task with a debug loglevel to create a log
> file, and I've tried using the <junitreport> task to create an HTML
> report of the test run, neither of which has resulted in anything
> which gives me a clue as to what the error is. Can someone suggest
> another approach?
>
> Thanks in advance for any suggestions.
>
>
> --James
>
